storyInfo: The supporters of Theresa, fighting for the ideals of Babel, perform spectacularly in the war. The balance tilts towards Babel.

attributes.content: Winter 1092
Border Battlefield, Kazdel
Those rampaging cystybeasts... are they migrating? The vanguard never stood a chance. All those who didn't get out of the way in time were...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: And those soldiers, moving in perfect coordination without exchanging a word... None of that was in the Intel!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: That's not what we need to worry about.
I'm the ranking officer now. All survivors, form up and retreat immediately. These supplies are crucial. It will be a hard winter without them.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am. But how did things go so wrong even though we made our move early? Did our informant—
attributes.name: Composed Soldier

attributes.content: The intel was good. We were delayed by the mercenaries transporting the supplies. They upped the price on the spot. I've dealt with them.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: This is why I hate mercenaries.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Another coincidence...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It's not a coincidence if it keeps happening over and over again. We've had way too many setbacks lately.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Focus, Babel forces must be—
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Wait, hel—
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: A flash of white, and a hole appears in the soldier's forehead. They cannot even tell where the attack is coming from, in the noise of the cystybeast stampede.

attributes.text: 'Leave the supplies behind, and you may leave unharmed. You have been warned.'

attributes.content: Without warning, Ulšulah hears a cold, coarse voice in her head.
He... he's dead. *Sarkaz expletive* We need to withdraw! Did you hear that voice?
attributes.name: Composed Soldier

attributes.content: Hmph... just a bluff! Keep your head low and stay with me!
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Don't get separated! Stick together, if you want to live! We need to get these supplies back!
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: As for the vanguard... we're in no position to think about them.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: They're retreating. I suppose nabbing the supplies isn't so easy after all.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.text: 'Be patient and follow the Doctor's instructions. The Chairman has said that the priority is to minimize casualties.'

attributes.content: I know, Mantra.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Mantra's lips are closed, but Scout can hear her voice clearly in his head.
She is the perfect coordinator for Babel's covert operations, and a shadow that eats away at the enemy's sanity.
The enemy vanguard has been scattered by the herd. The survivors have fled into the woods.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: The enemy's actions were spontaneous, unplanned. They must have known that we decrypted their communications. But the envelopment succeeded nonetheless.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: We can leave the rest to Ascalon.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Ascalon will not fail.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Neither will we.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Hah, you're absolutely right. You should get some rest, Mantra. 'Talking' takes a toll on you.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: No need to worry about the follow-up. We have the Doctor.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Who directed this operation... the evil spirit again? Just what is this commander? Which Royal Court does it come from?
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: If it can do this to us, it can do it to you too! Why would you sell your soul to something like that?!
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: I'm getting out of here alive—
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: The mercenary hears breathing in the darkness not far away and swings his sword without hesitation.
Got you!
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: You're wounded too. You think you could kill me and walk away alive?
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: Get out of my way, or I'll kill you, if it's the last thing I do!
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: You're not taking Marcel's things. He's going home.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Home? *cough* *cough*—
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: Our home is... Kazdel! You— traitors to Kazdel...
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: The mercenary keeps swinging his sword at Odda, who only passively blocks with his hammer.
The mercenary's movement slows down, and his breathing grows weak.
Babel... morons...
attributes.name: Dying Mercenary

attributes.content: Wasn't it the Military Commission who betrayed Kazdel?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Relax. He's dead.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Be more decisive next time, Odda, and there'll be fewer injuries.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The entire squad is dead... they should have died an honorable death, not tormented by fear—
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: This is not the right time to show mercy. Bring Marcel. Our mission is finished.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You... you remember his name?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: I remember everyone in Babel, the living and the dead, the ones who had names, and the ones who didn't.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I could have saved him... it's just hard to raise your weapon against your own kin.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Even if it's to avenge Marcel?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Your father died in the chaos of the city. Have you ever thought about seeking vengeance for him?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Odda takes a deep breath.
I hate the people who killed him, but vengeance doesn't change anything.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: A classical idea. Rational, righteous, human.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: What if your vendetta is with a cold-blooded deathmonger, with hands soaked in blood?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Would you say you kill for justice and your ideals, without a hint of hatred?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I... I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Do you regret killing mercenaries who threaten Babel, Ascalon?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Then I won't either.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Even if it means I have to...
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: O-Oh, I'm sorry! I'm saying silly things again. Don't mind me, I'm not important at all—
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: No, all Babelites are important to Her Highness.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Time to go back.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
What are you here for?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: I've already said it many times. It was my own decision to betray Her Highness.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: It had nothing to do with the Military Commission, and I'm not an informer for them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: You want to execute me, make it quick.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: I'm not here to torture you.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: I brought some wine.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: I don't need it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Are you sure? This is Victorian fruit wine, not some lousy swill.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: What are you here for?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: To catch up about old times.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: We have nothing to talk about.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: I know Scout's hiding something from me. Ascalon would too, because she knows we know each other.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: But I can make a pretty good guess why you wanted to kill the Doctor.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Be my guest.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: You're not a sore loser. You're unhappy because the Doctor is an outsider.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Everyone wants Babel and the Military Commission to get along. You believe that Dr. Kal'tsit and the Doctor have widened the rift, rather than mended it.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Good guess. Now get out.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: I'm an outsider too. And I'm still fighting for the Sarkaz to this day.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: The wine.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: You're drinking out of your hat?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Do you see a wine glass in this cell? You should have brought one.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: *gulp* — Ah.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: What happened to the rest of your team?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Let's see... the one with the spear, the caster, the one with the shield who's sitting here right now, a medic, and a sniper?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Skullspear, White Smoke, Grey Sun, Stross, Walnut, Kung, Herb.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: So the sniper's name was Herb.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: He's dead. Let bygones be bygones.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: All good fighters.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: If I ever get to mentor the young, I'll raise them to be that kind of fighter.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Selfless, honest, cautious about picking a side, but committed once they've made their choice.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Pah. How sentimental.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Do the Sarkaz hate outsiders in Babel that much?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Fools like you who would give your lives for Her Highness wouldn't understand.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Babel might be changing certain things, but it's meaningless. It's not fast enough, and its reach is not far enough.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Her Highness did not have to have her hands tied. She didn't need to waste her time.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: The Doctor helped Chairman Theresa a lot.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: In what capacity?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: A researcher? A military commander?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Both.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Even though the Doctor killed so many Sarkaz? The more people like that, the longer the war will drag on.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Her Highness's achievements are grand. She's solved problems all her life, taken care of the needs of generations, and now she leads the fight against Oripathy.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: But what's happening now? We're fighting the Military Commission. Fighting our own. That's not part of her vision.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Oh, I almost forgot. You're a mercenary, but you're not a Sarkaz mercenary.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: True enough.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: I only came to Babel because I was with the others. I got involved in this because most of my people were Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Oh, White Smoke is dead, too.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Why bring her up now?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: I thought maybe there was something going on between you two.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Doesn't matter. She's dead.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: She died in the presence of Chairman Theresa.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Damn, now I'm starting to envy her. What happened?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Ambush. Only the two of us survived, but she lost her legs to an Arts trap. I had to drag her through the mud.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: That's when we ran into Chairman Theresa. Well, we ran into the Doctor first.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Pah. The evil spirit showed up on the battlefield personally?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Believe it or not, I thought I was looking at a Lateran priest when I first saw the Doctor in the distance.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: The Doctor was praying with that black hood bowed low, next to the glowing Chairman.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Wasn't even kneeling or doing any sort of ritual, just gazing silently into the distance with Chairman Theresa.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: That evil spirit you're talking about, Dr. {@nickname}, is not some heartless monster.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: The Doctor is torn, wandering in solitude... and still, in the end, chose to bring victory to Babel.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: So you came to preach? You're trying to guilt-trip me?!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Get out and take your bloody wine! Did you think I would—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: No, you're not that naive.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Has a decision been made?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Death sentence?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: The Doctor and Chairman Theresa had reservations, but Dr. Kal'tsit and most of the fighters who participated in the operation won't have it any other way.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Your betrayal cost us dozens of lives, brother.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: This time, I'm with Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Hmph. More wine.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: You just spilled the last of it.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Are you gonna be doing it?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Yes. No need to burden Scout. He's tough on the outside but tender inside. And I don't want to hand you over to anyone else.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: I came to tell you, brother, that even though you did something stupid...
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Babel will remember your name. We'll keep fighting, keeping your warning and reproach in our hearts.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Train some promising young ones while you still can. Decent ones like you don't live long.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Traitor

attributes.content: Guess so.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: See you again, when the Sarkaz can finally live in peace.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: The traitors and spies have been executed. Royal Court spies. They really have a lot of problems in their tribe.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Good work. What about the unit that entered the war zone?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Scouts report that they blocked key passages leading out of the mountains after attacking Babel positions.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: The General did not order this. Was it someone from a Royal Court... or a Siracusan plot?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Unlikely. Reports indicate no particular bloodline characteristics to the witchcraft, and little effort was made to cipher communications. It's a rabble.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: May I speak frankly, sir? The unit may be rogue, but they just happened to cram Babel in with the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Isn't that a good thing for us?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: What about the other commanders and mercenary captains?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Watching the show, of course, waiting to see if the enemy chooses to surrender, or die at the hands of the Catastrophe and the ruffians.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: I wouldn't overthink it if I were you, sir.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: You've shown as much mercy as you possibly could by ordering that we pull out of the valley and leave an opening for them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Who knows, maybe some of my family are in that Catastrophe. I've gotten over it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: You don't care?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I try not to.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
Sorry I'm late.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: No need to start from the beginning. Ace was called on short notice. Just follow Mantra's instructions.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Go ahead. We don't have much time.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Emergency?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: I'll keep going then.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: We have twenty five hundred souls in the Catastrophe radius, mostly medics, Infected civilians, prisoners, and injured mercenaries.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The scale of the Catastrophe is larger than the Catastrophe Messengers predicted. It's currently expected to affect five outposts, three key passages, and a field hospital repurposed from an abandoned town.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: They had almost made it out of the Catastrophe radius when their path was cut off by mercenaries.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Trapping medics, wounded and civilians to die in a Catastrophe?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Is Manfred willing to go to such lengths these days?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: It's not his style. The three Military Commission units have retreated from the forest, even leaving a humanitarian corridor open in one of the canyons.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The Military Commission has casters on the cliffs, ready to annihilate any armed unit that attempts to pass through.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: But they're not trying to hide what they're doing, and they're not doing anything we didn't expect.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: These mercenaries are different. They came out of nowhere, attacked our positions, destroyed important roads and bridges, and polluted several water sources in the mountains with Originium explosives. There seems to be no reason with their actions.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Who's their employer?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: We're still looking into it, but based on what little intelligence we have, it's very likely that they're rogue.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Revenge, a last-gasp struggle after being abandoned by Theresis, instigation by another country... anything's possible.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Doesn't matter. I'll find out who their leader is, and kill them.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Without leader, a band of aimless mercenaries is just a useless rabble.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You go save those people. We'll regroup back at base.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I'll leave them to you, then.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: One last message. Her Highness says this operation is not part of the 'campaign'.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: We should be relieved.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: In a war that has become increasingly gridlocked, the opposing sides have a chance to work together for a common goal...
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Saving lives from Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Mantra
